Issues.Title: Image tag generics rule duplicates minireset's
Issues.Body:
This is an **improvement** that removes a rule duplicated rule between `generics` and `minireset`.

### Proposed solution

Minireset already declares the following, therefore the _generics_ rule for `img` is not needed, and can be removed.

```
img,
video
  height: auto
  max-width: 100%
```

### Tradeoffs

Custom builds that include `generics` and not `miniresets` will lose the `img` rule.

### Testing Done

Checked that the rule is no longer duplicated, but still present.

### Changelog updated?

No.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Image tag generics rule duplicates minireset's" (#2679)

Issues.Title: findDarkColor() not changing the colour
Issues.Body:
This is about **Bulma**.

I'm not sure if it's a bug or by design.

### Overview of the problem

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**
I'm using Bulma **0.8.0**

### Description

I want to get a dark version of #e20e76.

Bulma's [`findDarkColor()`](https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/35e3ccbd042d137640420cc39f1e8e870b7db618/sass/utilities/functions.sass#L91) function doesn't seem to work; in contrast `findLightColor()` does appear to work.

Is the `colorLuminance()` function supposed to produce the same result as SASS's `lightness()` function?  In this case `colorLuminance(#e20e76)` is roughly `0.19` whereas `lightness(#e20e76)` is 47%.  Which is what [`$target-l`](https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/35e3ccbd042d137640420cc39f1e8e870b7db618/sass/utilities/functions.sass#L96) turns out to be here.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Set a SASS property value to `findDarkColor(#e20e76)`.  E.g.

```sass
body
  color: findDarkColor(#e20e76)
 ```

### Expected behavior

I expect the resulting colour to be darker than the given one.

### Actual behavior

The resulting colour is unchanged, i.e. #e20e76.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "findDarkColor() not changing the colour" (#2678)

Issues.Title: How to use custom colors (v0.8.0)?
Issues.Body:
This is about **Bulma**. ### Overview of the problem This is about the Bulma **CSS framework** I'm using Bulma **version** [0.8.0] I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate** ### Description I read the blog post about [light and dark colors](https://bulma.io/2019/10/15/light-dark-colors/#light-dark-colors) in v0.8.0 but I'm not quite sure how to take advantage of the new functionality. It sounds like if I add a custom color, Bulma will calculate the inverted color, a light version, and a dark version. However I'm not sure how to get hold of these calculated colors. ### Steps to Reproduce 1. I made a `$custom-colors` map in my sass: ```sass $custom-colors: ("foo": #f3488c) ``` 2. I added some html which works: ```html this works as expected

this works too

``` 3. But this doesn't work: ```html oh dear

oh noes

``` Am I wrong to expect that to work? 4. I found another way to get at the calculated colors but it seems a bit roundabout. In my sass: ```sass .bar color: nth(map-get($colors, 'foo'), 4) // These don't compile because there's no such variable: // color: $foo // color: $foo-dark ``` Then in my html this works: ```html ok

also ok

``` Please can you tell me whether there's a better way? Many thanks in advance!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "How to use custom colors (v0.8.0)?" (#2674)

Issues.Body:
This is about **Bulma**. ### Overview of the problem This is about the Bulma **CSS framework** I'm using Bulma **version** 0.7.5 My **browser** is: Android Chrome ### Description Im working with Bulma fullheight hero for a big call to acion on a mobile website. Issues.Title: Tabs within a Message component inherit the wrong styles
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is about **Bulma**.

<!-- Is it about Bulma or about the Docs? -->
<!-- Is it a bug/feature/question or do you need help? -->
<!-- If it's a bug, is it a browser bug? -->

### Overview of the problem

<!-- UNCOMMENT THE APPROPRIATE LINES -->

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework** 
<!-- This is about the Bulma **Docs** -->
I'm using Bulma **version** 0.7.5 
My **browser** is: Chrome 77 on Ubuntu, Firefox 69 on Ubuntu
<!-- This is a **Sass** issue: I'm using version [x.x.x] -->
I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate**? :pray: 

### Description

If you use a "tabs" component inside a "message" component, the tab label text (which is an `a` tag) inherits the wrong color, and gets an underline style.

The CSS rule responsible appears to be:

```css
.message a:not(.button):not(.tag):not(.dropdown-item) {
	color: currentColor;
	text-decoration: underline;
}
```

### Steps to Reproduce


1. Copy and paste the markup for a **message** component [from the docs](https://bulma.io/documentation/components/message/)
2. Copy and paste some [**tabs** from the docs](https://bulma.io/documentation/components/tabs/#styles) into the message component

Example on codepen: https://codepen.io/foundryspatial-duncan/pen/vYYGoMX

### Expected behavior

Tabs should appear as they do in the documentation, or as they do outside of a message component. Selected tab would have white text with the default styles.

<!-- What you expected to happen -->

### Actual behavior

Tab labels are underlined like a regular hyperlink, and the selected tab text is the same color as the rest of them.

<!-- What actually happened -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Tabs within a Message component inherit the wrong styles" (#2654)
